column4: Why does sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg detect the wrong graphic card, the old one? How can I fix that?
ignore the autodetected one, choose the proper driver at the next screen and enter the PCI ID of the card when it asks (find it out with lspci)
Ispci?
no, Lspci
with lspci
sorry but what is LSPCI?
enter 'man lspci' to find out
how do I access LSPCI?
ok, I got the menu. What option do I pick from there?
what menu?
that's not a menu, it's a manual page. If you read it, you will learn how to use lspci
it is *not* a menu
I understand but how do I select one of the option to view the PCI id of the graphic card?
lspci is a command line program
sorry for spell name mistake and my lack of knowledge. :(
never mind. Have you found the PCI ID of your new graphics card?
I'm trying but I have no idea how to do that! :(
I'm sorry.
just enter 'lspci' in the terminal, like any other command. It will do what the man page explains: "list all PCI devices" along with their IDs
you chose the more difficult sequence... It's easier to install ubuntu after windows.
it's definitely easier that way.
you could also see how it goes with ubuntu alone. Some people don't even need Windows, because Ubuntu has equivalents for everything they do.
others are happy running Windows programs under wine, although wine isn't fully mature yet
and yet another possibility is to run Windows in a virtual machine, e.g. qemu (free software) or vmware (closed software)
